adjectives.description: performative (comparative more performative, superlative most performative)

entries.meaning: (philosophy, linguistics) Being enacted as it is said.
examples: Saying "I do" as part of a wedding ceremony is performative, enacting a marriage.

entries.meaning: Being done as a performance in order to create an impression.
examples: With the danger of science becoming purely “performative” (Lyotard 1984), not seeking any pretense of “truth” but simply performing a service for those in charge while still occupying its decision-making role in a technocratically dominated political sphere  […]
The distinction between constatives and performatives is one of the distinctions that he starts questioning.
